entries: The Guild Wars franchise is the flagship franchise of the Washington state based development studio ArenaNet.
The 16th entry into it's now 20 year old story is Guild Wars 2 Visions of Eternity.
This book aims to capture the story and the feelings of this beloved game, and bring them to the gaming table with the help of the Dungeons & Dragons 5 edition rule set.
All credit goes to the amazing people at ArenaNet and NCSoft, who have given us players such magical adventures.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The Fox Spirit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 fire damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The otter spirit can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Escape
entries: The Hare Spirit can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Toad Spirit can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Toad Spirit's {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB} is up to 10 feet and its {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} is up to 5 feet with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Ignite
entries: {@b Description:} Familiar Passive. Gain might when you inflict burning. Might can be gained once per interval.

optionalfeature.name: Splash
entries: {@b Description:} Familiar Passive. Heal allies when you grant them regeneration.

optionalfeature.name: Zap
entries: {@b Description:} Familiar Passive. Gain increased ferocity while under the effects of fury.

optionalfeature.name: Calcify
entries: {@b Description:} Familiar Passive. Gain protection when you disable an enemy. Protection can be gained once per interval.

optionalfeature.name: Conflagration
entries: {@b Description:} Familiar. Summon the fox to attack your target, inflicting burning and then spreading burning on that foe to nearby enemies.

optionalfeature.name: Buoyant Deluge
entries: {@b Properties:} Familiar, Heal, Removes Conditions, Stun

{@b Description:} Familiar. Summon the otter to throw a massive ball of water at the target location. When the ball lands, it heals allies in the area and removes conditions from them while stunning enemies.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Blitz
entries: {@b Description:} Familiar. Summon the hare to shadowstep to and attack enemies around your target for critical damage.

optionalfeature.name: Seismic Impact
entries: {@b Properties:} Familiar, Knockdown, Grants Protection, Barrier
{@b Description:} Familiar. Summon the toad and slams the ground, knocking down enemies and creating a rocky barrier that enemies can't cross. Allies in the area gain protection.

optionalfeature.name: Rejuvenate
entries: {@b Description:} Meditation. Heal yourself and charge your familiar skill.

optionalfeature.name: Fox's Fury
entries: {@b Properties:} Meditation, Grants Boons, Inflicts Burning, Break Stun

{@b Description:} Meditation. Grant boons to nearby allies, then inflict burning on your target based on the amount of might you have. If fire is your specialized element, this skill breaks stun, grants additional boons, and strikes enemies around your target.

optionalfeature.name: Otter's Compassion
entries: {@b Properties:} Meditation, Removes Conditions, Grants Boons, Break Stun

{@b Description:} Meditation. Remove conditions from nearby allies while granting them boons and increasing their incoming healing for a duration. If water is your specialized element, this skill breaks stun for nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Hare's Agility
entries: {@b Properties:} Meditation, Grants Endurance, Grants Swiftness, Break Stun, Inflicts Blind
{@b Description:} Meditation. Gain endurance and swiftness. Your next few strikes create an arc of chain lightning. If air is your specialized element, this skill breaks stun and grants blur.

optionalfeature.name: Toad's Fortitude
entries: {@b Properties:} Meditation, Block, Grants Protection, Grants Resistance, Break Stun

{@b Description:} Meditation. Block incoming attacks, then strike nearby enemies with shattering rocks. Gain protection to nearby allies if this skill completes successfully. If earth is your specialized element, this skill grants resistance to allies and breaks stun.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Procession
entries: {@b Description:} Meditation. Summon all four familiars to use their empowered skills.

optionalfeature.name: Evocation
entries: Select an element to specialize in, greatly reducing its recharge time and gaining a familiar of that element. The familiar's basic skill charges as you use weapon skills, charging more rapidly when you use a weapon skill of its element. Using the familiar's basic skill three times will enable its empowered skill. Gain access to meditation skills.

optionalfeature.name: Fiery Might
entries: Burning you inflict deals increased damage. Deal increased strike damage to burning foes.

optionalfeature.name: Altruistic Aspect
entries: Meditation skills grant boons to allies.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit's Succor
entries: Heal yourself when you use a familiar skill.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Potency

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Fiery Might|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Altruistic Aspect|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Spirit's Succor|GW2VoE}

entries: Improve a boon based on your familiar.

optionalfeature.name: Familiar's Blessing
entries: Grant boons to nearby allies when you use a familiar skill.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Dynamo
entries: Gain one familiar charge when attuning to your selected element.

optionalfeature.name: Familiar's Prowess

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Familiar's Focus|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Familiar's Blessing|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Elemental Dynamo|GW2VoE}

entries: Gain a temporary bonus after using a familiar skill.

optionalfeature.name: Galvanic Enchantment
entries: After you use a familiar skill, your next strike creates an arc of chain lightning. Chain lightnings created by evoker skills inflict burning.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Balance
entries: Every second time you enter your selected attunement, the next elementalist weapon skill you use will recharge faster.

optionalfeature.name: Specialized Elements
entries: You cannot leave your selected attunement. Your familiar's basic skill recharges more quickly, and activating it recharges your weapon skills by a small amount. Activating your familiar's empowered skill recharges your weapon skills and triggers traits if you are attuned the attunement.

optionalfeature.name: Mitotic State
entries: {@b Description:} Your slime stimulates your cells to regenerate, healing you rapidly over time. The healing is increased while you have barrier.

optionalfeature.name: Solid State
entries: {@b Properties:} Stance, Leap, Stun, Grants Stability
{@b Description:} Stance. Leap into the air as you command your body to compact, stunning enemies upon landing. Gain stability and increase your outgoing stun durations for a duration.

optionalfeature.name: Liquid State
entries: {@b Description:} Stance. Quickly melt down into a puddle, evading all incoming attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Gaseous State
entries: {@b Properties:} Stance, Break Stun, Removes Conditions
{@b Description:} Stance. Sublimate, breaking stun from yourself. Remove movement-impairing conditions and prevent their reapplication.

optionalfeature.name: Plasmatic State
entries: {@b Properties:} Stance, Inflicts Damage, Inflicts Burn
{@b Description:} Stance. Superheat your body and lash out, damaging and burning enemies struck. Your outgoing strike and condition damage is increased for a duration.

optionalfeature.name: Flux State
entries: {@b Description:} Stance. Your slime rapidly spins around you, creating a magnetic field. Pull in nearby enemies as a metallic storm swirls around you.

optionalfeature.name: Experimental Union

prerequisite.other: Access to the Amalgam Elite Specialization.

entries: Through asuran ingenuity, you are host to a mercurial mold. You are able to command it using selectable morph skills that replace your toolbelt skills or even fully merge with it to evolve into a superior being. Morph skills selected will alter the composition of the mercurial mold, changing the bonuses it grants you when you evolve. Gain access to stance utility skills.

optionalfeature.name: Stainless Steel
entries: Convert conditions to boons when you use a stance skill or evolve.

optionalfeature.name: Innervating Alloy
entries: Heal every second while you have barrier. Heal when you evolve.

optionalfeature.name: Hardened Chrome
entries: Morph skills and evolving grant protection to yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Vigor

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Stainless Steel|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Innervating Alloy|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Hardened Chrome|GW2VoE}

entries: Gain vitality. Gain barrier when you use a morph skill.

optionalfeature.name: Carbolic Composition
entries: Amalgam skills inflict poison on hit. Poison you inflict lasts longer.

optionalfeature.name: Mercurial Tendencies
entries: Disabling an enemy reduces the cooldown of Evolve.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Lining
entries: Evolve no longer inherits bonuses from strains. Morph skills grant their strain bonuses.

optionalfeature.name: Willing Host

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Carbolic Composition|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Mercurial Tendencies|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Silver Lining|GW2VoE}

entries: Using a morph skill increases your damage for a duration.

optionalfeature.name: Symbiotic Synergy
entries: Evolve recharges morph skills. Morph skills deal increased strike damage.

optionalfeature.name: New Genes
entries: Evolve grants boons to allies. Grant an additional boon based on which morph skill was used.

optionalfeature.name: Double Helix
entries: Evolve has two charges and grants an increased attribute bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Rally the Valiant

prerequisite.other: Access to the Paragon Elite Specialization.

entries: Gain access to chants and command skills. Gain motivation by using a chant or by using a burst skill while a refrain is active.

optionalfeature.name: Call to Action
entries: Gain motivation when you enter combat. If no refrains are active, automatically activate the refrain of Chant of Action.

optionalfeature.name: Calming Tongue
entries: Chant of Recuperation removes conditions from affected allies when activated.

optionalfeature.name: Liberating Liaise
entries: Chant of Freedom grants superspeed to affected allies when activated.

optionalfeature.name: Inspiring Implements

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Call to Action|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Calming Tongue|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Liberating Liaise|GW2VoE}

entries: Gain concentration. Gain motivation when you swap weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Strengthening Stanzas
entries: Refrains grant bonus effects to you while they are active.

optionalfeature.name: Invigorating Tempo
entries: Heal yourself and gain adrenaline for each point of motivation spent.

optionalfeature.name: Reverberation
entries: Command echoes can trigger a second time.

optionalfeature.name: Unyielding Resolve

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Strengthening Stanzas|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Invigorating Tempo|GW2VoE} or {@optfeature Reverberation|GW2VoE}

entries: Strike and condition damage dealt to you is reduced for each point of motivation you have.

optionalfeature.name: Feverish Pulse
entries: Using a chant reduces the recharge of your other chants and grants boon to affected allies.

optionalfeature.name: Brisk Pacing
entries: Deal increased damage based on your motivation level.

optionalfeature.name: Enduring Refrain
entries: Refrain effects of chants are stronger. Gain additional motivation when you activate a chant.

optionalfeature.name: Chant of Action
entries: {@b Description:} {@b Burst. Chant.} Applies boons to allies in an area around you.

{@b Effect:} {@b Refrain.} After activation, continually applies boons to allies while removing motivation every interval. This effect lasts until you run out of motivation stacks or another chant is activated. Gain increased effects depending on motivation stacks.

optionalfeature.name: Chant of Recuperation
entries: {@b Description:} {@b Burst. Chant.} Grants barrier to allies in an area around you.

{@b Effect:} {@b Refrain.} After activation, continually pulses healing to allies while removing motivation stacks every interval. This effect lasts until you run out of motivation stacks or another chant is activated. Gain increased effects depending on motivation stacks.

optionalfeature.name: Chant of Freedom
entries: {@b Description:} {@b Burst. Chant.} Breaks stun from allies in an area around you.

{@b Effect:} {@b Refrain.} After activation, continually grants swiftness to allies while removing motivation stacks every interval. This effect lasts until you run out of motivation stacks or another chant is activated. Gain increased effects depending on motivation stacks.

optionalfeature.name: "We Shall Return!"
entries: {@b Description:} Command. Heal yourself and allies in an area around you.
{@b Effect:} {@b Echo.} Heals again and removes conditions on allies after a set interval or after you use a burst skill.

optionalfeature.name: "Find Their Weakness!"
entries: {@b Description:} Command. Strike enemies around your target, inflicting vulnerability and spreading vulnerability from your original target to nearby enemies.
{@b Effect:} {@b Echo.} Apply might to allies and gain adrenaline based on the number of enemies after a set interval or after you use a burst skill.

optionalfeature.name: "Never Surrender!"
entries: {@b Properties:} Command, Break Stun, Grants Boons
{@b Description:} Command. Break stun while granting boons to nearby allies. The cooldown of this skill is increased if used to break a stun.
{@b Effect:} {@b Echo.} Grant additional boons to nearby allies after a set interval or after you use a burst skill.

optionalfeature.name: "Brace Yourselves!"
entries: {@b Description:} Command. Apply barrier to yourself and allies around you.
{@b Effect:} {@b Echo.} Apply barrier again to allies after a set interval or after you use a burst skill.

optionalfeature.name: "On Your Knees!"
entries: {@b Description:} Command. Damage and apply conditions to enemies around you.
{@b Effect:} {@b Echo.} Damage and immobilize enemies after a set interval or after you use a burst skill.

optionalfeature.name: "We Will Never Yield!"
entries: {@b Properties:} Command, Grants Barrier, Grants Superspeed

{@b Description:} Command. Your allies' health cannot be reduced below zero for a short period of time. After this effect ends, grant barrier proportionate to their missing health. Certain boss skills may bypass the effect of this skill.
{@b Effect:} {@b Echo.} Grant superspeed to nearby allies after a set interval or after you use a burst skill.

table.name: Evoker Familiars
rows: Once per turn, when you inflict {@variantrule Burning|GW2} on a creature, you gain 1 round of {@variantrule Might|GW2}.
When you grant a creature {@variantrule Regeneration|GW2}, they also regain {@dice 1d4} hit points.
While you have {@variantrule Fury|GW2}, your critical hits and {@variantrule Critical Failure|GW2|Critical Failures} inflict an additional {@dice 1d6} lightning damage.
Once per turn, when you {@variantrule Disable|GW2} a creature, you gain 1 round of {@variantrule Protection|GW2}.

table.name: Skritt Swipe Benefits
rows: You gain resistance to psychic damage until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain resistance to slashing or piercing damage (your choice) until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain resistance to radiant damage until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain temporary hit points equal to the Challenge Rating of the target or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.
You gain a fly speed equal to your movement speed until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.

You gain resistance to the damage type the elemental is immune to until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again. If the elemental is immune to more than one damage type, choose one. If the elemental is not immune to any damage type, you gain resistance to one damage type of your choice until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You can use your bonus action to teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this benefit until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain resistance to fire or poison damage (your choice) until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
Your reach increases by 5 feet until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain GP equal to 10 times the Challenge Rating of the target or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.
You gain advantage on saving throws against being {@variantrule Frightened|XPHB} until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain resistance to acid damage until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain advantage on saving throws against being {@variantrule Restrained|XPHB} until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.
You gain resistance to necrotic damage until you use {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} again.

subclassFeature.name: Evoker
entries: You have adopted the Evoker Elite Specialization. You gain proficiency with {@item Warhammer|XPHB|Warhammers}, {@item Spear|XPHB|Spears (Terrestrial)}, {@item Pistol|GW2|Pistols}, {@item Shortsword|XPHB|Shortswords} or {@item Warhorn|GW2|Warhorns} and can use their {@variantrule Weapon Skill|GW2|Weapon Skills}.

You now qualify to learn Evoker specific {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}, {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}, and {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills} when you choose your skills.
You have learned to attune to the elements. Choose one of the following elements: Fire, Water, Air, or Earth. You attune to that element.

As an Evoker you made a profound connections to the Spirits of the Wild. Choose one familiar spirit from the {@table Evoker Familiars|GW2VoE} table. Your familiar spirit accompanies you and grants you the passive benefit as described in the table. You can change your familiar spirit when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Elite Specialization
entries: You gain access to the {@table Elementalist Traits|GW2|Evoker} Specialization and learn its Minor Adept {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait} {@optfeature Evocation|GW2VoE}.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Connection
entries: Your connection to the Spirits of the Wild deepens. Choose a second different element from Fire, Water, Air, or Earth to be able to attune to.

During your turn, you can now attune to a different element (no {@variantrule Action|XPHB} required). Once you leave an element, it must recharge ({@chance 55|10+}) before you can attune to it again. The element associated with your familiar spirit does not need to recharge.

subclassFeature.name: Manifested Familiar
entries: You can manifest your familiar spirit to aid you. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to cast the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell without material components.

When you cast the spell in this way, your familiar is Elemental, taking the form of the spirit you chose with the Evoker feature as shown in the {@table Evoker Familiars|GW2VoE} table. It disappears if you take a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Additionally, while your familiar is manifested, you can ask it for aid. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast the {@spell Augury|XPHB} spell without material components, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Bond
entries: The spirits allow you to form a deeper connection with the elements. Choose a third different element from Fire, Water, Air, or Earth to be able to attune to.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Manifestations
entries: You can now manifest your greater familiar spirit to aid you. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to transform your manifested familiar into its greater form as shown in the {@table Evoker Familiars|GW2VoE} table. After an hour, it reverts to its normal form unless you expend another {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to maintain the transformation.
The rules for your familiar remain otherwise unchanged.

Additionally, while your greater familiar is manifested, you can ask for insight. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast the {@spell Commune|XPHB} spell without material components, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Mastery
entries: You have mastered your connection to the elements. Choose the final element from Fire, Water, Air, or Earth to be able to attune to.

subclassFeature.name: Familiars' Gift
entries: Your familiar spirit bestows a gift upon you. You always gain the Primordial Supremacy benefit associated with your chosen familiar spirit's element.
Additionally, when you attune to that element, the benefit is further enhanced as described below:
- {@b Fire Attunement}: Your {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} increases to 300 feet and your {@sense True Sight|XPHB} range increases to 60 feet.
- {@b Water Attunement}: You can temporarily turn your body into water. You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
- {@b Air Attunement}: Your {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} increases to 90 feet.
- {@b Earth Attunement}: Your {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} increases to 300 feet and your {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} increases to twice your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Ascendance
entries: Your bond with the elemental spirits reaches its pinnacle. Once per long rest, as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can call upon the spirits for aid. Depedning on your choosen familiar spirit, you can cast one of the following spells without material components, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them:

subclassFeature.name: Antiquary
entries: You have adopted the Antiquary Elite Specialization. You gain proficiency with {@item Rifle|GW2|Rifles}, {@item Staff|XPHB|Staffs}, {@item Spear|XPHB|Spears (Terrestrial)}, {@item Handaxe|XPHB|Handaxes} or {@item Scepter|GW2|Scepters} and can use their {@variantrule Weapon Skill|GW2|Weapon Skills}.

You now qualify to learn Antiquary specific {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}, {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}, and {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills} when you choose your skills.
You can steal ancient artifacts from your foes. You gain access to the {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} skill.
Additonally, you gain a bonus to your Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB} and {@skill History|XPHB}) checks. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).
Lastly, you have learned to identify valuable trinkets. You can use the {@variantrule Identify|XPHB} spell as a ritual without Material components, Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Elite Specialization
entries: You gain access to the {@table Thief Traits|GW2|Antiquary} Specialization and learn its Minor Adept {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait} {@optfeature Trinket Collector|GW2VoE}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Swipe
entries: Your {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} skill improves. The range increases to 60 feet, and you can now use it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Artifact Specialist
entries: You have studied various ancient artifacts and learned their secrets. You can innately tell if an item is magical or mundane, as well as its rarity, if it is cursed, and how to us it. You do not learn the specific properties of the item, only general information about it.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice.
Furthermore, the time required to attune to a magical item, or end attunement, is reduced to 1 minute.

Lastly, you have a knack for finding hidden treasures. You can add double your proficiency bonus to any {@skill Perception|XPHB} or {@skill Investigation|XPHB} check you make to locate hidden doors, compartments, or objects.

subclassFeature.name: Swipe Specialist
entries: Your {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} skill further improves. The range increases to 90 feet, and you now longer need to see the target to use it.
Additionally, depending on the type of creature you target with the skill, you gain additional benefits as described in the {@table Skritt Swipe Benefits|GW2VoE} table.

subclassFeature.name: Artifact Curator
entries: You have become an expert in identifying and appraising ancient artifacts. When you buy or sell a magical item, you can do so at a 10% better price.
Additionally, you can now attune to one additional magical item beyond your normal limit.

Lastly, when you defeat a creature with a challenge rating equal to or greater than your Level, you can roll a {@dice d100}. If you roll equal to or below the challenge rating of the creature, it is carrying an uncommon magical item (DM's choice) that you can claim.

subclassFeature.name: Swipe Perfection
entries: Your {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} skill reaches its pinnacle. The range increases to 120 feet, and it no longer requires an action to use.
Additionally, when you use the skill, you can choose to target two creatures within range instead of one.

subclassFeature.name: Artifact Master
entries: You have mastered the study of ancient artifacts. You can now attune to two additional magical items beyond your normal limit.
Additionally, the price you pay or receive when buying or selling magical items increases to 25%.

Lastly, when you defeat a creature with a challenge rating equal to or greater than your Level, you can roll a {@dice d100}. If you roll equal to or below the challenge rating of the creature, it is carrying a rare magical item (DM's choice) that you can claim.

subclassFeature.name: The Perfect Swipe
entries: You have perfected your {@optfeature Skritt Swipe|GW2VoE} skill. The range increases to 150 feet, and you can now use it to target up to three creatures within range.
Additionally, when you use the skill, you can choose which benefit from the {@table Skritt Swipe Benefits|GW2VoE} table to apply for each target, regardless of their creature type.

Lastly, you can now target friendly creatures with the skill. When you do so, they suffer no harm and instead gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus. Additionally, they can choose one benefit from the {@table Skritt Swipe Benefits|GW2VoE} table to gain for 1 minute.
